dmca.title: Infringing Use of AOL
dmca.body:
T 

 

________________________________

From: Huffnagle IV, Henry [mailto:huffnagle.henry@arentfox.com] 
Sent: Tuesday, March 13, 2007 4:44 PM
To: Copyright; mgaston@theplanet.com
Cc: Davis, Jim
Subject: Infringing Use of AOL

 

Dear Martin, 

As you may remember from prior correspondence with my colleague, Jim
Davis, this firm represents AOL LLC ("AOL") in connection with
intellectual property matters.  Our client owns the famous AOL mark and
numerous registrations in the United States and around the world.  

We recently learned that an entity, "Usual Media Group, Ltd," has
registered the domain name "JUICYSBADGIRLS.COM" in connection with a web
site that provides adult content and uses our client's name and the AOL
mark as a metatag.  This unauthorized commercial use of AOL dilutes the
distinctive quality of our client's name and mark in violation of
trademark and other laws.  Despite our best efforts to contact the
registrant by mail, e-mail, and telephone, we have been unable to do so.
We have filed a report with the Internet Corporation for Assigned Names
and Numbers (ICANN), based on what appears to be inaccurate WHOIS
information. 

Our research, however, also indicates The Planet.com is hosting the
"JUICYSBADGIRLS.COM" web site and that this type of misuse of
third-party intellectual property violates your company's hosting
Acceptable Usage Policy.  We therefore request that you deactivate this
domain name.

As we hope you can appreciate, AOL is very concerned about this
unauthorized use of its famous name and mark and would like to reach a
swift and amicable resolution of this matter.  We thank you in advance
for your assistance.  We look forward to hearing from you and are
available to answer any questions you may have.

Sincerely, 

Henry 

Henry Huffnagle IV 
Arent Fox LLP 
1050 Connecticut Avenue, NW 
Washington, D.C. 20036-5339 
Phone: 202.857.6302 
Fax: 202.857.6395 
huffnagle.henry@arentfox.com 

IRS Circular 230 disclosure:
To ensure compliance with requirements imposed by the IRS, we inform you
that, unless expressly stated otherwise, any U.S. federal tax advice
contained in this communication (including any attachments) is not
intended or written to be used, and cannot be used, for the purpose of
(i) avoiding penalties under the Internal Revenue Code or (ii)
promoting, marketing or recommending to another party any transaction or
matter addressed herein.
